title: Fork, ca. 1775–1800
markings: On neck: F, leopard's head, lion passant; Tardy, Silver (1981) p. 247, 250; London 1861?
creditline: The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg
description: Silver gilt fork has three curved tines, baluster-shaped neck, oval in section. Banded ferrule. Tapering jasper handle, oval in section, light blue ground with raised design in white. S-shaped scrollwork, acanthus leaves and flowers on both sides. On front a woman in greek costume holding a disk in one hand, the other hand above the fire in the burner next to her. Beaded cresting along the sides of the handle, floral decoration at the top of the handle, a metal cap in the centre.

exhibitions.title: Feeding Desire: Design and the Tools of the Table, 1500-2005

tombstone.epitaph:
Fork, ca. 1775–1800.
ca. 1775–1800. silver, gold, jasper. The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg. 1985-103-208.
